result.execSummary:
The defendant Riley J Kleist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PSI Waived      3-3-16.  AJC imposing conditional jail time

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample.

  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

timeConds.notes: with credit for 43 days time served.

IMPOSED AND STAYED

3-3-16 Per request of agent and waiver by defendant.  Court lifts stay and imposes 60 days conditional jail time.  In addition Court imposes additional 120 days jail for a total of 180 days conditional jail time. NO HUBER. NO GOOD TIME. Sentence shall commence 2-22-16.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Credit as listed below.
